isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - OPERATION

svcproc.title: AIR DRYER
svcproc.para: Turning the key switch ON applies ignition power on circuit 13AH to energize the Air Dryer Control Relay (146). With the relay energized, battery voltage on circuit 14AD/F10-A/39A from Battery Adapter B1 passes through the relay normally open (N.O.) contacts (30 to 87). It then flows out the relay on circuit 39B and through connector 1-E and is applied to the air dryer assembly's electrical pigtail.

The air dryer thermocouple closes at less than 50°F, applying battery power to the heater element located in the air dryer assembly. The air dryer control relay ground circuit 13-GAD is grounded through Ground Adapter (455), then through 11-GE to ground stud at left dash panel.
